channel.title: sendFrame200() <-- Whats it do?
channel.description:
Hi. I have recently started working on my server (UnScape) again, after quitting about 4 months ago. I have just noticed an error in my old quests dialogue, making the client disconnect when [code] sendFrame200(615, 974); [/code] Is called. It's probably my client, but i have made far too many server/client changes - Things like login error messages, login verification, etc, that stop my client from working on other clients - to go back to the moparscape client again.
When i commented out sendFrame200(), it just showed the message, the players head, any everything else i can remember the moparscape client showing.
I was wondering what sendFrame200() does, and if it is really needed or not.
~Unborn

item.title: sendFrame200() <-- Whats it do?
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

Its most likely something like sendFrame126. Meaning that it doesn’t have an effect on the character and its for menus; etc.

Read full topic

item.title: sendFrame200() <-- Whats it do?
item.dc:creator: @bencorbett bencorbett
item.description:
@bencorbett wrote:

Hi. I have recently started working on my server (UnScape) again, after quitting about 4 months ago.
I have just noticed an error in my old quests dialogue, making the client disconnect when

sendFrame200(615, 974);

Is called. It’s probably my client, but i have made far too many server/client changes - Things like login error messages, login verification, etc, that stop my client from working on other clients - to go back to the moparscape client again.

When i commented out sendFrame200(), it just showed the message, the players head, any everything else i can remember the moparscape client showing.

I was wondering what sendFrame200() does, and if it is really needed or not.

~Unborn
